episodes.title: Members of religious sect sentenced to jail for the manslaughter of Elizabeth Struhs | 7.30
episodes.description:
A Brisbane judge today sentenced 14 members of the extreme religious sect called The Saints to jail time after an eight-year-old diabetic girl died in their care.

Elizabeth Struhs died four days after she was denied insulin. Her mother and father were part of the group, which didn't believe in medical treatment.

In her first interview since the trial, Elizabeth's older sister Jayde has spoken to 7.30's Alexandra Blucher. Produced by Raveen Hunjan.

Subscribe: https://ab.co/3yqPOZ5   Read more: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-02-26/jayde-struhs-inside-the-saints-elizabeth-struhs-death/104954652

episodes.title: Religious group members found guilty of manslaughter of eight-year-old girl | 7.30
episodes.description:
Fourteen members of a small, extreme religious group called The Saints have been found guilty of the manslaughter of eight-year-old Queensland girl Elizabeth Struhs.

Among the 14 are Elizabeth's parents, who made the catastrophic decision to stop giving her life-saving medication.

7.30’s Alexandra Blucher reports.

Subscribe: https://ab.co/3yqPOZ5

episodes.title: Inside the school where 'purity is everything' | Four Corners
episodes.description:
Former students speak out about disturbing practices at their Australian high schools, alleging they were taught false information about sex. 

One private school student says she was told watching porn would cause holes in her brain. Another says students were told getting a lifesaving cancer vaccine would encourage them to be promiscuous. Many say their experiences left them psychologically scarred. 

The schools are connected to the secretive Catholic organisation Opus Dei. 

Here, Four Corners goes inside the little-known world of Opus Dei and investigates its links to senior politicians. 

Chapters:  
0:00 Intro: Secrets and shame 
3:10 ‘It’s about virginity’ 
7:41 ‘Recruitment’ into Opus Dei 
13:20 ‘Don’t be a slut’ 
16:37 Self-mortification 
19:28 Vaccine ‘promotes promiscuity’ 
22:45 Porn ‘causes holes in the brain’ 
29:11 Consent education 
32:39 Homosexual acts ‘a sin’ 
36:26 Political links 
40:24 Physical relationship  
 
This Four Corners documentary was originally broadcast as ‘Purity’ on January 30, 2023, on ABC TV and ABC iview. 

Read more about the story here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2023-01-30/inside-sydney-opus-dei-affiliated-private-schools/101777060    

Full statements from Opus Dei Australia and the Pared Foundation can be found on the Four Corners website: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2023-02-15/purity:-an-education-in-opus-dei/101979020  

Update: Dominic Perrottet stepped down as New South Wales Liberal leader after losing the state election in March 2023.

episodes.title: Escaping Jehovah's Witnesses: Inside the dangerous world of a brutal religion | Four Corners
episodes.description:
Former Jehovah's Witnesses are fighting back against a religion that failed them. They know they'll lose their loved ones for doing so.
 
Subscribe: https://www.youtube.com/c/abcnewsindepth
 
Few know the extreme nature of the beliefs of the Jehovah's Witnesses, a religious group which boasts eight million followers in multiple nations.
 
They take a strict interpretation of the Bible and predicted the world would meet its ‘wicked end’ in 1914, 1925 and 1975.
 
A US-based Governing Body of eight men sits at the pinnacle of the Jehovah’s Witnesses organisation. Witnesses believe these men are anointed as the voice of God on Earth. 
 
Former members reveal the secretive practices used to instil fear and maintain discipline among followers.
 
With strict rules governing every aspect of their lives, these former Witnesses say the organisation is controlling and dangerous.
 
They say it's time to hold the Jehovah's Witnesses to account.



_________
